result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul R Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$150.00 cash bond posted to be applied.
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul R Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul R Martinez in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement reached.
Amend Information to delete domestic abuse and domestic abuse repeater.  Court grants amendment to amend to simple disorderly conduct  947.01 - Class B Misdemeanor.
Court questions Defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty, Court accepts and finds guilty.

Argument by State.  $150.00 posted to be applied to Court costs.
Argument by Defense.
Defendant addresses Court.  

Court orders Court costs only - 60 days to pay.
